020
021import net.tnemc.core.EconomyManager;
022import net.tnemc.core.account.Account;
023import net.tnemc.core.account.holdings.HoldingsEntry;
024import net.tnemc.core.account.holdings.HoldingsHandler;
025import net.tnemc.core.currency.type.ItemType;
026import net.tnemc.core.utils.Identifier;
027
028import java.math.BigDecimal;
029import java.util.ArrayList;
030import java.util.LinkedList;
031import java.util.List;
032import java.util.Optional;
033
034import static net.tnemc.core.EconomyManager.VIRTUAL;
035
036/**
037 * Represents a type of currency.
038 *
039 * @author creatorfromhell
040 * @see Currency
041 * @since 0.1.2.0
042 */
043public interface CurrencyType {
044
045  /**
046   * @return The name of this currency type. Examples: Virtual, Item
047   */
048  String name();
049
050  String description();
051
052  /**
053   * @return True if this currency type supports offline players, otherwise false.
054   */
055  default boolean offline() {
056
057    return true;
058  }
059
060  /**
061   * @return True if this currency requires setting the player's balance when they log in. This
062   * should be true for currency types like item currency.
063   */
064  default boolean loginCalculation() {
065
066    return false;
067  }
068
069  /**
070   * @return If balances of this currency type should be saved to the database. Return false to do
071   * your own data handling.
072   */
073  default boolean database() {
074
075    return true;
076  }
077
078  default boolean supportsVirtual() {
079
080    return true;
081  }
082
083  /**
084   * @return True if this currency type is based on physical items.
085   */
086  default boolean supportsItems() {
087
088    return (this instanceof ItemType);
089  }
090
091  /**
092   * @return The {@link Identifier} of the default handler.
093   */
094  default Identifier defaultHandler() {
095
096    return VIRTUAL;
097  }
098
099  /**
100   * @return True if this currency type supports the exchange command set, which is used to exchange
101   * from items to/from virtual.
102   */
103  default boolean supportsExchange() {
104
105    return false;
106  }
107
108  /**
109   * Used to get the holdings for a specific account from this currency type.
110   *
111   * @param account  The uuid of the account.
112   * @param region   The name of the region involved. This is usually a world, but could be
113   *                 something else such as a world guard region name/identifier.
114   * @param currency The instance of the currency to use.
115   * @param type     The {@link Identifier} of the holdings handler to use.
116   *
117   * @return The holdings for the specific account.
118   */
119  default List<HoldingsEntry> getHoldings(final Account account, final String region, final Currency currency, final Identifier type) {
120
121    final LinkedList<HoldingsEntry> holdings = new LinkedList<>();
122    final List<HoldingsHandler> handlers = new ArrayList<>();
123
124    if(type.equals(EconomyManager.NORMAL)) {
125
126      handlers.addAll(EconomyManager.instance().getFor(account, currency, this));
127
128    } else if(type.equals(EconomyManager.ITEM_ONLY)) {
129
130      final Optional<CurrencyType> curType = EconomyManager.instance().currency().findType("item");
131      curType.ifPresent(currencyType->handlers.addAll(EconomyManager.instance().getFor(account, currency, currencyType)));
132
133    } else {
134
135      final Optional<HoldingsHandler> handler = EconomyManager.instance().findHandler(type);
136      handler.ifPresent(handlers::add);
137    }
138
139    for(final HoldingsHandler handler : handlers) {
140      holdings.add(handler.getHoldings(account, region, currency, this));
141    }
142    return holdings;
143  }
144
145  /**
146   * Used to set the holdings for a specific account.
147   *
148   * @param account  The uuid of the account.
149   * @param region   The name of the region involved. This is usually a world, but could be
150   *                 something else such as a world guard region name/identifier.
151   * @param currency The instance of the currency to use.
152   * @param type     The {@link Identifier} of the holdings handler to use.
153   * @param amount   The amount to set the player's holdings to.
154   *
155   * @return True if the holdings have been set, otherwise false.
156   */
157  default boolean setHoldings(final Account account, final String region, final Currency currency, final Identifier type, final BigDecimal amount) {
158
159
160    final Optional<HoldingsHandler> handler = EconomyManager.instance().findHandler(type);
161
162    if(handler.isPresent()) {
163
164      if(handler.get().database()) {
165        addDatabase(account, region, currency, type, amount);
166      }
167
168      return handler.get().setHoldings(account, region, currency, this, amount);
169    } else {
170
171      final Optional<HoldingsHandler> handler1 = EconomyManager.instance().findHandler(defaultHandler());
172      if(handler1.isPresent()) {
173        if(handler1.get().database()) {
174          addDatabase(account, region, currency, defaultHandler(), amount);
175        }
176
177        return handler1.get().setHoldings(account, region, currency, this, amount);
178      }
179    }
180    return false;
181  }
182
183  default void addDatabase(final Account account, final String region, final Currency currency, final Identifier type, final BigDecimal amount) {
184
185    final HoldingsEntry entry = new HoldingsEntry(region, currency.getUid(), amount, type);
186    account.getWallet().setHoldings(entry);
187
188    //TNECore.instance().storage().store(entry, account.getIdentifier());
189  }
190}
